text: The 12th District of the Wisconsin Senate is located in north-eastern Wisconsin, and is composed of parts of Vilas, Oneida, Florence, Lincoln, Marinette, Langlade, Menominee, Oconto, Shawano and Forest Counties.District Map ==Current elected officials== The 12th district is currently vacant, after Tom Tiffany was elected to congress for Wisconsin's 7th congressional district. He had been near the end of his second four-year term, after being elected in 2012 and re-elected in 2016. Before serving as a senator, he held an office in the State Assembly, serving the 35th District from 2011 to 2013.Holperin Biography The area of the 12th Senate District contains three State Assembly Districts:District Map * The 34th (represented by Rob Swearingen) * The 35th (represented by Mary Czaja) * The 36th (represented by Jeffrey Mursau) The 12th district is located partly within Wisconsin's 8th congressional district, which is represented by U.S. Representative Mike Gallagher.Congressional District Map The other part of the district is located within Wisconsin's 7th congressional district, which is represented by U.S. Representative Tom Tiffany.Congressional District Map ==Past senators== Past senators include:Wisconsin Blue Book, 1991-92 edition, Statistics: History, pages 657-666. Note: the boundaries of the district has changed repeatedly over history. Previous politicians of this district have represented a completely different geographic area, due to redistricting. The district definitions for the given era are specified in the "District definition" column. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" ! Legislative Session ! Senator ! Party ! Years ! Notes !
